title: With Changes To Guantanamo Trials, A New Feel To Proceedings
teaser: The case of Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, the self-confessed architect of the Sept. 11 attacks, is moving slowly. NPR's Arun Rath talks with Carol Rosenberg of the Miami Herald about the latest in that legal process and other Guantanamo trials.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
